snippet: Supporters say drug-testing programs serve as deterrents, but critics claim they may offer little benefit to students and society.
abstract: Proponents of drug testing at the high school level say that it offers students a way to say no to drugs and that it serves as a deterrent, but others question the effectiveness of such programs; New Jersey State Interscholastic Assn tests about 500 student-athletes per year at a cost of about $100,000, and rate of positive tests has never exceeded 1 percent.
lead_paragraph: Supporters say drug-testing programs serve as deterrents, but critics claim they may offer little benefit to students and society.

headline.seo: Drug Tests for High School Athletes Fuel Debate
headline.main: Differing Views on Value of High School Tests
headline.print_headline: Differing Views on Value of High School Tests

keywords.value: National Center for Drug Free Sport
keywords.name: organizations
